Christopher Klamm

UKP lab, Technical University Darmstadt. klamm@ukp.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de.

Hi, I am Christopher a doctoral researcher in Natural Language Processing @ UKP TU Darmstadt, Prof. Dr. Iryna Gurevych. My work focuses on interdisciplinary research in Natural Language Processing for political and social good. I hold a master degree (2018, with distinction) in Computer Science (with a minor in philosophy) from the Technical University Darmstadt (abroad semester at the University of Zurich and ETH Zurich (special student and research/ student assistant @ Computational Social Science, Prof. Dr. Helbing)) and I hold a master degree in Governance and Public Policy from the Technical University Darmstadt (2019).

Research Interest:

  • NLP for political and social/ public good
  • NLP enriched methods for political science (e.g., framing or argumentation analysis)
  • NLP-based (political) bias analysis
